page.title: 13Parish Church, Wombourne
page.content: In the centre of the village facing the village green stands the church of St.Benedict Biscop.Although the present building dates back to 1851, the first religious building on this site was erected over one thousand years ago. The present church has a bell tower with 8 bells and a very tall spire. In recent years 80000 pounds had to be raised to renovate these parts of the church. On the tower there are 2 clock faces. Inscribed on the clock mechanism inside are these words. KEEP ME CLEAN AND OIL ME WELL AND I TO YOU THE TIME WILL TELL In the grounds of the church there are many gravestones which are very old.The inscriptions on some have been worn by the weather. Inside there is a vault underneath the church. It is used by the Shaw-Hellier family who used to own much of the surrounding land.
